ARABIC: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَٰهَآ ءَايَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We left it as a Sign. But is there any rememberer there?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who will be warned?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And We left the Ark as a Sign. Is there, then, any who will take heed?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We made (the story of Noah) as evidence of the Truth. However, is there anyone who would take heed?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We left it as a sign – so is there one who would ponder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And indeed, We have left this as a sign. Then is there any that will remember
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And certainly We left it as a sign, but is there anyone who
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We left it for a sign. Is there any that will remember?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have left this as a sign: but will anyone take heed?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly We left it for a sign. Is there then anyone who would be admonished?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Certainly We have left it as a sign; so is there anyone who will be admonished?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And indeed, We have left this as a sign, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We have left it as a sign. Is there any that will remember?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who would take heed?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:15] And verily We left it, We preserved this [deed], as a sign, for whomever might be admonished by it, in other words, the news of this [deed] became widely-known and endured. So is there anyone who will remember?, [anyone who] will take heed from, or be admonished by, it? (muddakir is actually mudhtakir, but the tā’ has been replaced with a dāl, likewise the dhāl, and it [the dāl] has been assimilated with it [the other dāl]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And verily We left it as a token) as a sign for people, i.e. We left the ark of Noah, after the death of Noah, as a sign for people; it is also said that this means: We left the similitude of Noah as a sign for people; (but is there any that remembereth) is there any that will take admonition from what was done to the folk of Noah and, hence, desist from transgression?
